intro: Lindernia laotica, commonly known as the Laotian lindernia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or violet in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Lindernia laotica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
